technology.name: Marching to War
technology.description: Ever onwards the Druchii armies march, conflict's breakneck rhythm dictating the pace.

effects.description: Speed: +10% for Dreadspears, Darkshards, Bleakswords and Black Ark Corsairs units

technology.name: Bolt Cartridges
technology.description: You'll like this, it's got a fast-action reload; you can kill the Asur all day long without pausing for more than a second.

effects.description: Ammunition: +25% for Reaper Bolt Thrower units
Missile strength: +10% for Reaper Bolt Thrower units
Reload time reduction: +10% for Reaper Bolt Thrower units

technology.name: Black Iron Armour
technology.description: The hardest of substances, when heated to the optimum temperature, may be drawn into mail, plate or scale.

effects.description: Armour: +10 for Dreadspears, Darkshards and Bleaksword units

technology.name: Bloodforged Platemail
technology.description: Black steel, mixed with sacrificial blood and etched with powerful runes, makes the best armour produced in Naggarond.

effects.description: Armour: +5 for Cold One Knights, Cold One Dread Knights and Cold One Chariot units
Armour: +10 for Har Ganeth Executioners and Black Guard of Naggarond units

technology.name: Driven by Vengeance
technology.description: The deep-seated, profoundly-ingrained desire for revenge consumes and drives one forward.

effects.description: Recruitment cost: -5% for Dreadspears, Darkshards and Bleakswords units
Melee attack: +4 for Dreadspears, Bleakswords, Black Ark Corsairs and Darkshards units

technology.name: Martial Society
technology.description: Every aspect of the Druchii world is directed to warfare, as it should be when war is a permanent state of affairs.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for Dreadspears, Darkshards and Bleakswords units

technology.name: Forged to Kill
technology.description: Steel is only as strong as the hand that wields it.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% for Dreadspears, Darkshards, Bleakswords and Black Ark Corsairs units
Missile strength: +10% for Darkshards and Black Ark Corsairs units

technology.name: Hit & Run
technology.description: To strike like lightning and then melt away - that is the way of the irregular warrior.

effects.description: Speed: +10% for Shades, Dark Riders and Doomfire Warlock units
Weapon strength: +10% for Shades, Dark Riders and Doomfire Warlock units
Reload time reduction: +10% for Shades and Dark Riders units

technology.name: An Instrument of War
technology.description: Muscle, flesh, and the skeleton that binds them can be finely tuned for maximum violence.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for Black Guard of Naggarond units
Recruit rank: +2 for Har Ganeth Executioners units

technology.name: Exotic Beast Hide Armour
technology.description: Some creatures have a natural outer carapace, so hard that it may double as armour once removed from its original owner.

effects.description: Armour: +10 for Black Ark Corsairs, Shades, Dark Riders and Doomfire Warlock units

technology.name: No Signs of Weakness
technology.description: Used to slaying their own kin at the first sign of fragility or compassion, Naggarothi armies constantly prune their own ranks.

effects.description: Leadership: +5 for Shades, Witch Elves, Har Ganeth Executioners, Black Guard of Naggarond and Sisters of Slaughter units

technology.name: Ceremonial Weapons
technology.description: The ornate, ceremonial weapons used in Khainite rituals give power to subsequent acts of murder carried out in his bloody name.

effects.description: Melee attack: +5 for Witch Elves, Har Ganeth Executioners and Sisters of Slaughter units
Weapon strength: +5% for Witch Elves, Har Ganeth Executioners and Sisters of Slaughter units

technology.name: Ascension Through Battle
technology.description: Through glorious warfare we may become worthy of Khaine's favour.

effects.description: Leadership: +5 for Dreadspears, Bleakswords, Darkshards, Black Ark Corsairs and Dark Riders units

technology.name: Reworked Crossbows
technology.description: Who could have imagined that the fingers of slaves would have so many uses?

effects.description: Ammunition: +20% for Darkshards, Black Ark Corsairs, Shades and Dark Riders units
Range: +15% for Darkshards, Black Ark Corsairs, Shades and Dark Riders units

technology.name: Walking in Darkness
technology.description: To reach certain destinations, one does not always need to see the way.

effects.description: Campaign movement range: +10%
Speed: +10% for Witch Elves, Black Guard, Har Ganeth Executioners and Sisters of Slaughter units

technology.name: Serrated Blades
technology.description: The many razor-sharp barbs and hooks may catch an opponent's blade, or rend their flesh.

effects.description: Melee defence: +5 for Black Guard of Naggarond units
Melee defence: +5 for Cold One Knights, Cold One Dread Knights and Cold One Chariot units
Weapon strength: +5% for Black Guard of Naggarond units
Weapon strength: +5% for Cold One Knights, Cold One Dread Knights and Cold One Chariot units

technology.name: Chartered Piracy
technology.description: Letters of Marque may be issued to those who pursue the Witch King's aims as their own.

effects.description: Upkeep: -5% for Black Ark Corsairs units
Income from sacking settlements: +20%

technology.name: Sadistic Handlers
technology.description: It does one's temperament good to channel aggression via the appropriate outlet.

effects.description: Speed: +10% for Harpies, War Hydra and Kharibdyss units

technology.name: Recruit Convicts
technology.description: Criminals make surprisingly good guards once it is made abundantly clear that the alternative is death.

effects.description: Upkeep: -5% for Dreadspears, Darkshards and Bleakswords units
Recruitment cost: -5% for Dreadspears, Darkshards and Bleakswords units

technology.name: Bewitch Dragon Eggs
technology.description: A source of great power, Black Dragon Eggs must be nurtured correctly so their potential is exploited to the fullest extent.

effects.description: Armour: +5 for Black Dragon units
Weapon strength: +10% for Black Dragon units

technology.name: Choose or Die!
technology.description: Some choices require next to no thought whatsoever.

effects.description: Income from slaves: +3%

technology.name: Battle as Business
technology.description: For the Dark Elves, war is transactional - for Druchii blood to be spilled there must be payment, in the form of loot, preferably.

effects.description: Income from post-battle loot: +10%
Income from raiding: +15%

technology.name: Naval Training
technology.description: You start with not drowning; once that has been achieved, the rest will swiftly follow - unless a watery grave appeals of course.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for Black Ark Corsairs, Shades and Dark Riders units

Melee attack: +4 when fighting at sea
	(all armies)

technology.name: Upgrade I
technology.description: Research the following items to take the Dark Elves' vicious military machine to another level of cruelty altogether.

effects.description: Black Ark growth: +3 (cumulative)

technology.name: Broken by the Lash
technology.description: The merest swish of leather is enough to make them alert and simply dying to obey.

effects.description: Speed: +10% for Cold One Knights, Cold One Dread Knights and Cold One Chariot units

technology.name: Dominating the Beasts
technology.description: They *will* obey, their own will buried deep beneath an overwhelming urge to comply.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for Harpies, War Hydra and Kharibdyss units

technology.name: Upgrade II
technology.description: Research the following items to take the Dark Elves' vicious military machine to another level of cruelty altogether.

effects.description: Black Ark growth: +5 (cumulative)

technology.name: Pressed into Servitude
technology.description: Society's detritus may yet find gainful employment in the service of the state.

effects.description:
Local recruitment capacity: +1
	(all provinces)

technology.name: Hunt Outlaws
technology.description: They live apart from the rest of Dark Elf society, waging an endless war against the enemies of Malekith.

effects.description: Upkeep: -5% for Shades, Dark Riders and Doomfire Warlock units
Recruitment cost: -5% for Shades, Dark Riders and Doomfire Warlock units

technology.name: Upgrade III
technology.description: Research the following items to take the Dark Elves' vicious military machine to another level of cruelty altogether.

effects.description:
Slaves used by buildings: -25%
	(all provinces)
Black Ark growth: +8 (cumulative)

technology.name: Under the Yoke
technology.description: The dark, feral Cold Ones must be broken to the will of their new masters.

effects.description: Leadership: +5 for Harpies, War Hydra, Kharibdyss and Black Dragon units
Leadership: +5 for Cold One Knights, Cold One Dread Knights and Cold One Chariot units

technology.name: Harnessed Fury
technology.description: So ferocious is the Hydra that their ravenous nature has proven the doom of many.

effects.description: Melee attack: +5 for War Hydra and Kharibdyss units
Melee defence: +5 for War Hydra and Kharibdyss units

technology.name: Bloodthirsty Companions
technology.description: Definitely not backwards in coming forwards, or indeed when getting stuck in.

effects.description: Melee attack: +5 for Harpies units
Armour-piercing weapon damage: +2 for Harpies units

technology.name: Daylight Denied
technology.description: Being beaten, half-starved and kept perpetually in darkness coaxes the very best work from the enslaved.

effects.description: Income from slaves: +3%
Income from Iron Mines, Gold Mines and Stone Quarries: +15%

technology.name: Spoils of War
technology.description: To the victor go the spoils - be they coin or place or the lives of the defeated.

effects.description: Upkeep: -5% for Harpies, War Hydra, Kharibdyss and Black Dragon units
Recruitment cost: -5% for Harpies, War Hydra, Kharibdyss and Black Dragon units

technology.name: Bred in Captivity
technology.description: An even more vicious breed of Cold Ones is now being born in captivity, raised on a strict diet of live flesh and warm blood.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for Cold One Knights, Cold One Dread Knights and Cold One Chariot units

technology.name: Revel in Suffering
technology.description: Ah, the suffering. The sweet, sweet suffering.

effects.description: Growth: +15

technology.name: Temple Training Grounds
technology.description: Where better to become proficient in the arts of war? Where the very soil is stained with the blood of failure!

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for Witch Elves and Sisters of Slaughter units

technology.name: Hardship & Cruelty
technology.description: Austerity, and the absence of any kind of warmth, can produce unexpectedly-positive results.

effects.description: Hero recruit rank: +2 for Death Hags
Hero recruit rank: +2 for Khainite Assassins
Melee defence: +5 for Doomfire Warlocks units
Melee defence: +5 for Lords and embedded Heroes

technology.name: Deadly Accountability
technology.description: There is no tolerance for failure in Naggarond, no matter how trivial the error.

effects.description: [HIDDEN - do not translate] Used to increase lord rank when replacing a lord (target the effect at forces factionwide) - use in conjunction with a shown effect that targets provinces factionwide
Lord recruit rank: +2
Leadership: +10 for Lords and embedded Heroes

technology.name: Founded on Tyranny
technology.description: Start as you mean to go on and your population will never know what they may be missing.

effects.description: Growth: +10

technology.name: Continuous Slave Supply
technology.description: There's always more work to be done and, fortunately, a constant stream of unfortunate wretches whose only option is to do it.

effects.description: Casualties captured post-battle: +15%
Income from Ports: +5%

technology.name: Tempered in Blood
technology.description: It is often necessary to execute a few - publicly of course - to quench the fires of revolt in all the others.

effects.description: Income from slaves: +3%

technology.name: Purge the Weak
technology.description: There is no place in the Druchii's empire of cruelty for those of a mild disposition.

effects.description: Income from Settlement buildings: +10%

technology.name: Consumed by Rivalry
technology.description: When hatred consumes the soul, what other reason can there be to carry on living?

effects.description: Loyalty: +2 for new recruits
Control: +1

technology.name: Divide & Conquer
technology.description: This aeons-old maxim never stops being true, and a most effective stratagem.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +10 with Dark Elves
Diplomatic relations: +10 with High Elves

technology.name: A Life of Dread
technology.description: Everyone, be they of high or low birth, have good cause to be fearful of who is watching and what they might tell the authorities.

effects.description: Ambush success chance: +5%
Income from slaves: +3%

technology.name: Endless Debauchery
technology.description: Every depraved, degenerate, impure licentiousness; everything to excess, for that is the Dark Prince's wish.

effects.description:
Slaanesh corruption: +1
	(all provinces)
Income from Settlement buildings: +15%

technology.name: Exploit Feuds
technology.description: A whisper here, a murmur there; winning is often most satisfying when others don't know you're playing.

effects.description: Control: +1

technology.name: Festivals of Ruin
technology.description: A gathering of those perversely in thrall to the Dark Prince, in the hope that his fickle eye be turned - and, thusly, his favour secured.

effects.description:
Slaanesh corruption: +1
	(all provinces)
Ward save: 5% for Witch Elves and Sisters of Slaughter units

technology.name: Masters of Murder
technology.description: In the Elven world, there are none more adept in the ignoble art of stealthy killing.

effects.description:
Assassinate action: Additional 5% success chance
	(all Heroes)
Melee attack: +5 for Doomfire Warlocks units
Melee attack: +5 for Lords and embedded Heroes

technology.name: Study the Chaos Wastes
technology.description: Where daylight hangs by a lunar noose. And the horned, hidden one is re-invoked.

effects.description: Hero recruit rank: +2 for Sorceresses
Recruit rank: +2 for Doomfire Warlock units
Ward save: 10% for Doomfire Warlocks units
